smell_analysis.justification: All 19 diagrams in the provided file contain visual elements and are not empty.
All use cases in the diagrams (e.g., Pages 2 and 3) are associated with at least one actor, either directly or via include relationships.
No use cases with synonymous names associated with the same actor were found.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package.
No redundant data copies were found in tables without Foreign Key connections. Shared column names like 'reg_aeg' represent distinct data for different entities (Isik vs Auto).
All use cases are consistently named using the verb-noun form in Estonian (e.g., 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Registreeri auto').
In the state diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud, LÃµpetatud) are reachable from the Start state.
In the activity diagram (Page 4), all actions (Otsi autot, Vali auto, etc.) are reachable through valid decision paths.
All relationships in class and database diagrams (e.g., Pages 6, 12, 17) have appropriate multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*, 0..1) at both ends.
No diagram exceeds the limit of 10 central elements. The densest diagrams (e.g., Page 15) contain 9 tables.
No class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram. The maximum observed is 5 connections for 'Isik' on Page 6.
The layout of elements is reasonably compact and uniform across all diagrams; no extreme distance outliers were observed.
All use cases and activity diagram actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found with 3 or fewer characters (shortest observed were 4 characters, e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik').
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
All attribute and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_number', 'isik_id').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Kasutajakonto').
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (e.g., tbl_, str) were found in element names.
